review: very fun really enjoyed my time combat was the best in my opinion every time you hit an enemy or an object you get the ability to jump again what this means is that you can basically infinitely air juggle if you make sure to get your timing right and trust me it feels so good to get the timing right
game_title: Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus

review: this game was clearly inspired by hollow knight that of course is not a bad thing as a fan of metroidvania and eastern culturemythology this game was amazing beautiful world and cool gameplay wrapped in a short but sweet story personally i would have liked the bosses to be a little harder but it was not a necessity they were still cool and fun 810
game_title: Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus

review: i would say this game is worth its price if you love platforming and metroidvanias the quest system is great and most side quests are decent and worth the time to complete them i have seen many metroidvania games where air combat is decent but not unique this game puts a focus on this mechanic and getting used to it is pretty fun i definitely would recommend this game

review: i had fun good art i liked the writing and the characters and i enjoyed the movement  this is definitely a very platforming heavy game though even many of the boss fights require some platforming one boss fight is literally chapter 6 from celeste lol if thats your jam you might like it if you really struggle with platforming well you might have very bad time  it was right up my alley though so it gets a thumbs up from me
game_title: Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus

review: this game is a great entry level metroidvania the game is just the right amount of challenging for someone who is just getting into the metroidvania genre its not too easy or too hard there is only one bad thing in this game and it doesnt have any real gameplay significance and doesnt occur until right before the third to last boss all in all 8410 if you like metroidvanias for the gameplay then youll like this game
game_title: Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus

review: love how the game looks and sound havent payed too much attention to the story but holy hell is the controls are a nightmare i know the game is built with controllers in mind and im stuck with keyboard and mouse but even then my main problem are my attacks having inconsistent hitboxes same can be said about the grapple its bad enough i cant aim the grapple during hard platform sections but its another when the prompt to use it never wants to show when i need it to
game_title: Bo: Path of the Teal Lotus

review: bo was an absolute treat to beat for the first time and i am shocked that this game has as few reviews as it currently does   i was amazed consistently by how much bo manages to feel similar to other games in the genre while embracing its own ideas and identity wholeheartedly this is truly something special  my only complaint is that the grapple button is rather inconsistent thats the only negative thing i can think of
